description: An introduction to world dance traditions, this course examines dance forms, functions, contexts,
and differing aesthetics found in selected cultures of Africa, Asia, Europe, the Middle East, the
South Pacific, and the Americas. The course includes lectures, discussion, video-viewing, and
required field-trips to dance events, in addition to studio experiences where students learn
dances from the cultures studied. No previous dance experience required.  Ticket/transportation
fee required. Offered alternate years during Interim.
